late night low carb tofu snack under 15 min

## Crispy Garlic Tofu Bites

A quick, low-carb tofu snack with crispy texture and bold garlic flavor, ready in under 15 minutes.

### Ingredients
- 14 oz (400 g) firm tofu, drained and pressed
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, finely minced
- 1 teaspoon soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free)
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil (optional, for flavor)
- 1 tablespoon chopped green onions (for garnish)

### Instructions
1. Cut the pressed tofu into 1-inch cubes. Pat dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
2. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat for 1 minute.
3. Add tofu cubes to the skillet in a single layer. Cook undisturbed for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on one side.
4. Flip the tofu cubes carefully with tongs or a spatula, then cook another 3-4 minutes until golden on all sides.
5. During the last minute of cooking, add minced garlic to the skillet and stir constantly for 1 minute until fragrant.
6. Remove skillet from heat. Drizzle the tofu with soy sauce and sesame oil (if using). Toss gently to coat evenly.
7. Transfer to a serving plate, garnish with chopped green onions, and serve immediately.

### Notes
- To make it even crispier, you can bake the tofu at 400°F (200°C) for 10 minutes after pan-frying, but this is optional.
